company: Beck et al. Serviços de Informática Ltda.
description:
Company Description

Beck et al. Services is a modern and global provider of infrastructure, communication, collaboration solutions and social support for medium and large business customers worldwide. We plan, implement, and operate innovative solutions for social collaboration, business communications, cloud-based infrastructures, next-generation workplace, and we help our customers solve their problems by using agile collaborative social support methodology. We engage in the dialogue of who needs help with who can solve and close the loop by sharing and disseminating knowledge.

Job Description

Our support practice will embed you within our globally distributed production teams, to collaboratively work with customer's power users and IT professionals to create amazing user and service experiences amongst different hybrid enterprise stacks on Office 365, Slack, MS SharePoint, IBM Connections/Workplace and Atlassian Jira/Confluence.

We are looking for a very communicative Support Analyst, fluent in spoken and written business English and native to client-side web applications and apps.

Qualifications

Your Responsibilities

Understand, research and solve issues from customers and DevOps peers, which traditional first level agents aren't able to address.
Document solutions in creative ways, i.e. by vlogs or multimedia kb.
Prepare and deliver learning bites for customers and peer team members.
Streamline deployment processes, establish procedures aiming fully automated healing of enterprise services.
Actively participate in the broader (enterprise) community, publishing blog posts, white papers and case studies.

Your Profile

You are a fluent English speaker.
You love computers and technology and bring strong, hands-on support experience with different web-based enterprise application stacks.
You master communications and collaboration with customers – out of the traditional agent/ticketing model. Logging the steps towards the solution is your running logic.
Ideally, you have worked with, and optionally you're certified for, a few of these technologies: Microsoft Office 365, Microsoft Sharepoint, IBM Connections.
Your personal skills make you a great teammate, excellent in technical thinking and connecting the dots.
You are passionately embracing scripting, eager to automate yourself out of the job - only to free yourself for even more solution thinking and social learning.
You hold a bachelor’s degree, not necessarily in Computer Science.

Additional Information

Your Team

We are a global IT services provider for medium and large international customers.
We envision, build, deliver and operate solution assemblies for enterprise social business collaboration, leveraging Microsoft, IBM and AWS tech stacks.
We are an agile team of teams, applying lean cloud automation while working in truly virtual global, cross-continental teams (Europe and Brazil).
Is a new family of 70+ people, working out of a bright office with an Alpine view in Munich, an office with sea view in Florianópolis, or out of Romanian’s silicon valley, Cluj-Napoca.
Regularly conducts sponsored team events/ happy hours, enjoying the freedom to choose your work equipment.

Contracting

Full-time period 8h/day = 40h/week, with the flexibility to start early and stop mid-afternoon or start noon and work late evening.
Benefits after 90 days experience period:
health insurance, extensible to wife/children
monthly meal/food vouchers
BYOD, subsidized by the company

Beck et al. Services is a modern and global provider of infrastructure, communication, collaboration solutions and social support for medium and large business customers worldwide. We plan, implement, and operate innovative solutions for social collaboration, business communications, cloud-based infrastructures, next-generation workplace, and we help our customers solve their problems by using agile collaborative social support methodology.   • We are an agile team of teams, applying lean cloud automation while working in truly virtual global, cross-continental teams (Europe and Brazil).

  • Benefits after 90 days experience period:
    • health insurance, extensible to wife/children
    • monthly meal/food vouchers
    • BYOD, subsidized by the company

description:
OUR STORY

At ST, we believe in the power of technology to drive innovation and make a positive impact on people, business, and society. We are a global semiconductor company, and our advanced technology & chips forms the hidden part of the world we live in today.

When you join ST, you will be part of a global business of more than 115+ nationalities and present in 40 countries, 50,000+, diverse and dedicated creators & makers of technology around the world!

Developing technologies takes more than talent: it takes amazing people who understands collaboration and respect. People with passion and desire to disrupt the status quo, push boundaries and drive innovation – whilst unlocking your own potential.

Working at ST means innovating for a future that we want to make smarter, greener, in a responsible and sustainable way. Our technology starts with you. Join us and start the future!

YOUR ROLE

This outstanding opportunity allows technically-minded students to broaden their system engineering skills and application knowledge, while gaining sales and marketing experience. Our vibrant and dynamic team-oriented work environment offers exposure to a variety of state-of-the art applications technology each day.

As an intern you will play a key role in helping to secure ST customer commitments and win business by working with our FAE's (Field Applications Engineers) and marketing teams to support customers’ engineering teams who are developing a wide variety of applications. The primary area of focus will be MCU (microcontroller) applications across a wide range of electronic markets using ST’s ARM Cortex-M based STM32 family.

To be effective in this role, the intern is expected to:

Work closely with the FAE and marketing teams to align proper product offering to end customer opportunities
Take customers’ designs to revenue by providing prompt and thorough technical support assistance to the FAE and marketing teams for on-going design activity

YOUR SKILLS & EXPERIENCES

Student currently pursuing a BS or MS in Electrical, Electronic or Computer Engineering
Experience with embedded systems such as microcontrollers and sensors
Code development and debugging skills in assembly and embedded C
Hardware troubleshooting skills using an oscilloscope, multimeter, protocol analyzers and signal generators
Knowledge of Python script for test automation
Solid verbal and written communication skills
Proficiency in English is mandatory

We encourage candidates who may not meet every single requirement to apply, as we appreciate diverse perspectives and provide opportunities for growth and learning. Diversity, Equity and Inclusion (DEI) is part of our company culture. Our DEI vision is, “At ST, you can be the true version of yourself”, we value all employee contributions and have zero tolerance for any kind of discrimination.

Joining us is also about a greater work-life balance and workplace with equal opportunities. Dedicated Employee Resource Groups for women and LGBTQIA+, hybrid work arrangements are amongst the many DEI & Sustainability initiatives that make us a great place to evolve your career.

To discover more, visit st.com/careers

Job Description

**Contrato por prazo determinado de 6 meses, prorrogável por mais 12 meses.

Responsável por acompanhar o desempenho da operação, orientando e buscando soluções para garantir os padrões de produção, qualidade e segurança. Realiza os reportes diários, liderando análises de causa raiz para os desvios de processo. Presta suporte para os operadores e áreas de apoio, sendo a ponte entre eles.

Responsabilidades:

  • Seguir as regras de ouro de segurança;

  • Ser responsável pela sua segurança e a dos demais colaboradores;

  • Liderar as reuniões de Tier 1 – reportando os dados de produção, repassando informações importantes e prioridades do turno para a equipe;

  • Responsável por fomentar a cultura de segurança, através de momentos EHS diários;

  • Montar as escalas e fazer a gestão dos revezamentos do turno (máquinas e intervalos);

  • Elaboração e alteração de documentações (Instruções de trabalho e Operações padrão);

  • Monitorar e garantir o volume de produção, justificando o não atendimento e buscando soluções;

  • Monitorar o scrap da área, liderando análises de causa dos problemas (8D);

  • Treinar e validar os treinamentos básicos de produção, realizando a gestão da matriz de qualificação;

  • Suporte a todas as demandas das operadoras, garantindo que todos os meios necessários para o processo de produção estejam disponíveis;

  • Fazer a gestão dos EPI’s da equipe de produção;

  • Liderar as ações de melhoria: foco em desempenho, segurança e redução e custo;

  • Líder 5S;

  • Líder de inventário, garantindo a acuracidade de saldos no sistema e consistência de apontamentos do turno;

  • Aplicar treinamentos de novos processos ou equipamentos para a equipe;

Pré-requisitos:

  • Formação superior em engenharias e áreas afins (em andamento ou completo);

  • Inglês básico (desejável).

  • Conhecimentos básicos de informática;

  • Liderança positiva;

  • Comprometimento e proatividade;

  • Bom relacionamento interpessoal;

  • Disponibilidade de horários.

Benefícios oferecidos:

Assistência médica

Assistência odontológica

Seguro de vida

Auxílio academia

Vale-alimentação

Vale-refeição

Vale-transporte

Auxílio-creche

Auxílio farmácia

Auxílio ótica

Auxílio material escolar

Bônus

Desconto em produtos

Temos orgulho de ser uma empresa que acredita no valor de trazer pessoas de diferentes perfis, talentosas e comprometidas. A maneira mais rápida de revolucionar a inovação é quando ideias diversas se reúnem em um ambiente inclusivo. Incentivamos nossos colaboradores a abordar os problemas coletivamente e desafiar de forma respeitosa o raciocínio uns dos outros. Somos um empregador focado em promover iguais oportunidades aos nossos colaboradores, comprometido a incentivar um local de trabalho inclusivo e diversificado.

OportunidadesVeterBR

Search Firm Representatives Please Read Carefully
Merck & Co., Inc., Rahway, NJ, USA, also known as Merck Sharp & Dohme LLC, Rahway, NJ, USA, does not accept unsolicited assistance from search firms for employment opportunities. All CVs / resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at our company without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of our company. No fee will be paid in the event a candidate is hired by our company as a result of an agency referral where no pre-existing agreement is in place. Where agency agreements are in place, introductions are position specific. Please, no phone calls or emails.
